Born and raised in Somerset County, Pennsylvania, I graduated from Shanksville Stoneycreek High School and received an Associates Degree from The Art Institute of Pittsburgh in Photography/Multi-Media.

After receiving my degree from the Art Institute, I was a photojournalist for over 23 years working for newspapers in both Pennsylvania and Alabama. These newspapers included: The Daily American, Somerset, Greensburg Tribune Review, Hanover Evening Sun and The Birmingham Post-Herald. Throughout my career, I earned numerous state, regional and national awards for both my photography and newspaper page design. During my career in Alabama, I was twice named Photographer of the Year by The Associated Press. My work has also been distributed world-wide by The Associated Press and has been published in magazines such as Sports Illustrated and US News and World Report.
Following my newspaper career, I was the University Photographer in the Marketing Department of Indiana University of Pennsylvania for 20 years.
